Interface FlowRPCOps

    • Method Detail

      • pauseFlow

        boolean pauseFlow(@NotNull
                  net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId id)

        Schedule a flow to pause. The flow might run until the next suspension point before pausing.

        Returns:
        whether the flow was successfully scheduled to pause.

      • pauseAllFlows

        boolean pauseAllFlows()

        Schedule all flows to pause.

        Returns:
        whether all the flows were successfully scheduled to pause.

      • pauseAllHospitalizedFlows

        boolean pauseAllHospitalizedFlows()

        Schedule all Hospitalized flows to pause.

        Returns:
        whether all the Hospitalized flows were successfully scheduled to pause.

      • retryFlow

        boolean retryFlow(@NotNull
                  net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId id)

        Retry a Hospitalised flow or a paused flow.

        Returns:
        whether the flow was successfully retried.

      • retryAllPausedFlows

        boolean retryAllPausedFlows()

        Retry all paused flows.

        Returns:
        whether all the flows were successfully retried.

      • retryAllPausedHospitalizedFlows

        boolean retryAllPausedHospitalizedFlows()

        Retry all paused flows which were hospitalised (before paused).

        Returns:
        whether all the flows were successfully retried.

      • recoverFinalityFlow

        boolean recoverFinalityFlow(@NotNull
                            net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId id,
                            boolean forceRecover)

        Recover a failed finality flow by id. forceRecover will attempt to recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state.

        Returns:
        true if a transaction is successfully recovered false if a transaction does not require recovery
        Throws:
        FlowRecoveryException - if there is an error whilst performing recovery
        See Also:
        forceRecover

      • recoverFinalityFlows

        @NotNull
java.util.Map<net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId,java.lang.Boolean> recoverFinalityFlows(@NotNull
                                                                                                      java.util.Set<net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId> ids,
                                                                                                      boolean forceRecover)

        Recover a specified set of failed finality flows by id. forceRecover will attempt to recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state.

        Returns:
        map of identified failed flows and whether they were successfully recovered.
        See Also:
        forceRecover

      • recoverAllFinalityFlows

        @NotNull
java.util.Map<net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId,java.lang.Boolean> recoverAllFinalityFlows(boolean forceRecover)

        Recover all failed finality flows as determined by associated status. Specifically, FlowState.FAILED TransactionStatus.IN_FLIGHT forceRecover will also attempt to

        • recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state.

        • recover issuance transactions which finalised locally but failed to propagate to observer peers.

        Returns:
        map of identified failed flows and whether they were successfully recovered.
        See Also:
        forceRecover

      • recoverFinalityFlowByTxnId

        boolean recoverFinalityFlowByTxnId(@NotNull
                                   net.corda.core.crypto.SecureHash txnId,
                                   boolean forceRecover)

        Recover a failed finality flow by transaction id. forceRecover will also attempt to recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state. This operation will attempt to recovery failed peers if the initiator-side of the transaction completed successfully.

        Returns:
        true if a transaction is successfully recovered false if a transaction does not require recovery
        Throws:
        FlowRecoveryException - if there is an error whilst performing recovery
        See Also:
        forceRecover

      • recoverFinalityFlowByTxnIds

        @NotNull
java.util.Map<net.corda.core.crypto.SecureHash,java.lang.Boolean> recoverFinalityFlowByTxnIds(@NotNull
                                                                                                       java.util.Set<? extends net.corda.core.crypto.SecureHash> txnIds,
                                                                                                       boolean forceRecover)

        Recover a specified set of failed finality flows by transaction id. forceRecover will also attempt to recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state. This operation will attempt to recovery failed peers if the initiator-side of the transaction completed successfully.

        Returns:
        map of identified failed transactions and whether they were successfully recovered.
        See Also:
        forceRecover

      • recoverFinalityFlowsMatching

        @NotNull
java.util.Map<net.corda.core.flows.StateMachineRunId,java.lang.Boolean> recoverFinalityFlowsMatching(@NotNull
                                                                                                              net.corda.core.flows.FlowRecoveryQuery query,
                                                                                                              boolean forceRecover)

        Recover flows matching the specified query criteria. forceRecover will also attempt to recover flows which are in a RUNNABLE, PAUSED or HOSPITALIZED state.

        Returns:
        map of identified failed flows and whether they were successfully recovered.
        See Also:
        forceRecover
